repnme.cdata!:
Venezuela - Water and Sewerage
            Decentralization Project in the State of Monagas

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Venezuela - Water and
            Sewerage Decentralization Project in the State of Monagas
            was unsatisfactory, the sustainability was unlikely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory and the borrower performance
            was unsatisfactory. The lessons learned indicated that the
            absence of coherent sector policies, a supportive legal
            framework, and an effective institutional structure makes it
            very difficult to implement a well-designed and fairly
            limited pilot project. Since private participation in water
            services is usually politically sensitive, it is important
            that it is associated explicitly with service improvements
            for the poor. In an environment of political turmoil in
            which government officials and staff changed frequently, the
            management contract provided some stability for the water
            services in Monagas and produced significant improvements in
            commercial/financial performance, and service. The failure
            of political authorities to support a tariff policy in
            secondary cities of Monagas, undermined the financial
            viability of Monagas Water and Sewerage. The project team
            and regional management made adequate concessions and
            provided an appropriate level of assistance to the
            government in light of the difficulties it was facing during implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Venezuela - Water and Sewerage
            Decentralization Project in the State of Monagas

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objectives of the Water
            and Sewerage Decentralization Project in the State of
            Monagas is to increase the efficiency and quality of the
            water supply and sanitation (WS&S) services in Venezuela
            through the development of a model for decentralization,
            institutional strengthening, and expanded private sector
            participation. The project has three specific objectives: 1)
            to assist in the strengthening of Monagas Water and Sewerage
            Company (AdM), develop its financial self-sufficiency, and
            involve the private sector in the management and operation
            of the company; 2) to rehabilitate and improve the quality
            of WS&S services in Monagas; and 3) to support sector
            development and decentralization at the national level,
            including water resources management. The project will
            include two components to finance: 1) regional institutional
            strengthening and investment in rehabilitating the existing
            WS&S systems in the State of Monagas to improve quality
            and efficiency of service delivery. This component will
            consist of: (a) institutional strengthening and support to
            AdM; (b) rehabilitation in urban areas; and (c)
            institutional development and rehabilitation of rural water
            systems; and 2) national institutional strengthening, which
            will include: (a) a technical assistance program; (b) a
            national training program; (c) a sector decentralization
            program; and (d) consulting services.
